data.text:
What does it take to work for the UN in some of the world’s most difficult and dangerous situations?

In Season 3 of our podcast 'Awake At Night', @MelissaFleming speaks with extraordinary UN staff members to find out! https://t.co/4C9nNQISfZ https://t.co/BEWpcz2D3e

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for the future. 

Our survival on this planet hinges on these few degrees.

Addressing the climate crisis & limiting temperature rise is possible, if we #ActNow. https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV via @UNFCCC https://t.co/hjfB9dMWYf

"In a world of plenty, we have no excuse for billions of people to lack access to a healthy diet. This is unacceptable."

-- @antonioguterres says changing food systems is smart and necessary investment. https://t.co/mBjtNUDlaw https://t.co/fILhlCJaof

"Measures taken to address the past will transform our future.” 

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet presents her report on systematic racism to the Human Rights Council. https://t.co/bsZuIF2Vhk #FightRacism https://t.co/TTnAF71NZK

The longer children are out of school, the less likely they are to return - and the higher the risk of child labour, child marriage, early pregnancy, violence and abuse.

In-person learning must resume as soon as possible, @UNICEF & @UNESCO urge. https://t.co/pnBZTeBeOR https://t.co/GFG2uqCKk9

We're losing biodiversity by destroying nature, but we can do something about it, if we #ActNow.

To guide #COP15 negotiations, @UNBiodiversity released global framework #ForNature with achievable goals to protect life on earth. https://t.co/0cCC8PWDIF 
https://t.co/S2einHKRaP

Between 720 and 811 million people faced hunger in 2020 - around 161 million more than the previous year. 

New #SOFI2021 report highlights the need for new approaches to food systems & urgent action to achieve #ZeroHunger. https://t.co/lkBCn9tEYV via @WFP https://t.co/RHZXFq60lx

“One child,
one teacher,
one book,
one pen 
can change the world." 
-- @Malala

Happy birthday to our youngest Messenger of Peace, who is championing girls' education around the world! https://t.co/3NLWh5RaY0

🧘‍♀️Meditating
📝Journaling
🥘Cooking
🏃‍♀️Running
Healthy daily rituals have been important for many of us amid #COVID19. 

During self-care month, UN communications chief @MelissaFleming shares some of the habits that have helped her cope during the pandemic. https://t.co/p9Hyd1e8c3

UN peacekeepers from Serbia are #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping, leaving their families behind to protect the most vulnerable. 

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ https://t.co/W789u3lRfy

Millions of people worldwide are denied a nationality, which can prevent them from attending school, seeing a doctor, getting a job & more. 

Having a nationality is not a privilege - it's a human right. https://t.co/gp2Y3AYWuN via @Refugees https://t.co/OdWW7xZjJS

It costs less than $1 to feed a child for a day.  

Use the #ShareTheMeal app & help @WFP to achieve #ZeroHunger: https://t.co/h6cesmIr4Y https://t.co/DmwofH7Cuw

Protecting our one & only planet is in everyone's interest. All of us can and must take #ClimateAction to help address the climate emergency. 

Follow us on @tiktok_us to get inspired to #ActNow. https://t.co/1Xd6Q0cgQw https://t.co/4TuKJV83Rk

"I was able to give back a little of what this country has offered me, when I came as a refugee 5 years ago."

Refugees like Dr. Khabbaz have been on the #COVID19 frontlines since the start of the pandemic.

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/YTEB1PTjMt

200 million women & girls alive today have undergone female genital mutilation (FGM). 

On Sunday's #WorldPopulationDay, join @UNFPA in speaking out against this human rights violation and help #EndFGM. https://t.co/RZ2zrLjoB6 https://t.co/TN0yu7YoVH

12 million girls are married off each year before reaching the age of 18. 

On Sunday's #WorldPopulationDay, join @UNFPA in speaking out against this human rights violation and help #ENDChildMarriage. https://t.co/RZ2zrLAZZG https://t.co/DR2CweJT6e
From providing warmth in Afghanistan, to food in Lebanon, shelter in Sudan, and water in Syria, see how @UNOCHA helped people around the world in 2020. https://t.co/cGRV0JQRsp

"We may not all be responsible for the past, but we are all responsible for the future."

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet explains that we cannot go back to the way things were before #COVID19, as that got us to the pandemic in the first place. https://t.co/qhZP9So5Lj https://t.co/X9evu0FGr5

Every two minutes a woman dies from preventable causes related to pregnancy and childbirth.

On Sunday's #WorldPopulationDay & every day, @UNFPA supports the essential work of midwives around the world. https://t.co/RZ2zrLAZZG https://t.co/nPM98WXmEJ

Humanity
Neutrality
Impartiality
Independence

These are the 4 principles guiding the UN's humanitarian work. More here: https://t.co/eMvJIuCjCn** https://t.co/U2KyDtQnwJ

♻️ Reduce
♻️ Reuse
♻️ Recycle

Take #ClimateAction by making small changes in your daily life to reduce waste. https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n #ActNow https://t.co/pzkxaRXzuR

The Holocaust began with words. 

Hate speech, stigma, discrimination & xenophobia are on the rise again. 

But education & knowledge can help prevent genocide. We must work together to #StandUp4HumanRights & 𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 all forms of discrimination & hatred."
https://t.co/VvfXtpZj0o https://t.co/zAfDLeBWvK

A person's country of origin or whether they are a refugee shouldn't have a bearing on whether they get access to vaccines.

The pandemic will only end when everyone is protected from #COVID19. https://t.co/eIovRy8r6N via @refugees #OnlyTogether

As the world races to end the pandemic, no country can end it alone. 

#OnlyTogether can we end #COVID19 — by sharing the vaccines fairly around the world. 

So let's:
⏩Share verified information
🧍🧍‍♀️Stand together
📢Speak up 
💳Donate https://t.co/zSzJbzN9Sl https://t.co/zcwkKe2Mwu

90% of countries are still reporting disruptions to essential health services amid #COVID19, which has increased health inequalities & shortened life expectancy. 

Details in @UNDESA’s new #SDGreport: https://t.co/iP69guwjkk https://t.co/j2APCx1Y8D

"All parties to this conflict must do their utmost to grant unrestricted humanitarian access, protect civilians & civilian infrastructure."

-- @antonioguterres welcomes Ethiopia’s pledge to allow humanitarian access to Tigray. https://t.co/oemeo7jLWd

During this week's #HLPF, @FIAFormulaE World Champion & @UNEP Clean Air Advocate @lucasdigrassi talks about Formula E's quest to address the climate crisis by accelerating the adoption of electric vehicles. Watch #SDGLive: https://t.co/jbNhoCwREU #ClimateAction https://t.co/XN9eN3uZbu

Syria: @antonioguterres welcomes Security Council decision to extend vital cross-border aid operation.

The reauthorization will ensure humanitarian assistance continues for over 3.4 million people in need, including 1 million children.
https://t.co/2bPQFZ03G0

"To restore trust in multilateralism, we need to deliver on vaccines, economic recovery & climate finance. With your leadership and political will, we can do it."

-- @antonioguterres tells finance ministers at #G20. https://t.co/aQITve24FX https://t.co/KO75xksVXa

🍵 Delivering food aid
💊 Providing medical supplies
💉 Ensuring equitable access to vaccines

See how the UN works around the world to support communities and countries in their fight against #COVID19 in our latest @TwitterMoments:
https://t.co/jCvXN7acwR

Colombia
Syria
Democratic Republic of Congo
These countries have the highest number of internally displaced people.
@Refugees works to save lives, protect rights & build a better future for those forced to flee. https://t.co/YM5TEcVHMK

https://t.co/tSRdt79OLY

Over 100 million #COVID19 vaccines have been delivered to 135 countries & territories through the UN-led COVAX initiative.

But more dose donations are urgently needed to ensure everyone is protected. Details from @UNICEF: https://t.co/X5RjHq4z3D https://t.co/LAZYXinwGz

UN peacekeepers from Mauritania serve at great personal risk & in harsh conditions to help others.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/M2BlMyMhAK

Half of the world’s children experience violence, with devastating & life-long consequences for their mental health - and #COVID19 has magnified the problem, says @antonioguterres, calling for more support for children’s mental wellbeing. https://t.co/htSzoNOnZz

Despite progress, obstacles for women to hold positions at the highest levels of power & influence in public administration persist - including in the #COVID19 response. 

Details from @UNDP: https://t.co/igsllC8NAf https://t.co/KfeOvJMrZW

To get the world back on its feet & recover from #COVID19 in inclusive, climate-resilient way, we must support developing countries to deliver on their ambition.

-- @antonioguterres calls for global solidarity to address climate crisis & provide vaccines. https://t.co/jPkIEIdhq6 https://t.co/HwUCHBMVUf

Check out this video to see how you can help stop misinformation spreading on WhatsApp.

Forwarded messages can spread harmful misinformation, especially amid #COVID19.  Take time to PAUSE & verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/fBGWhnc72Q #PledgeToPause https://t.co/PHU71bpEvR

Improved weather forecasts, early warning systems and climate information could save 23,000 lives per year and create at least US$162 billion in economic benefits, according to the new Hydromet Gap report. @WMO explains: https://t.co/BlYcNAZcbI https://t.co/MVCHFDH9jX

"The tragic loss of four million people to the pandemic must drive our urgent efforts to bring it to an end for everyone, everywhere."

-- @antonioguterres as the world reached four million deaths from #COVID19. https://t.co/pERnd5r93T https://t.co/D8s0CDHweQ

Our colleagues from @WFP work to save & improve the lives of more than 115 million people in over 80 countries.

Here are 6 things you should know about the 2020 #NobelPeacePrize laureate. https://t.co/MHTRwcfCNj

https://t.co/UjXbfDtEbG

#ClimateAction = action for jobs

Protecting our planet is in everyone's interest: Transitioning to a green economy can unlock new economic opportunities & jobs - saving money & lives. https://t.co/qICEEM4aqh https://t.co/pio46XGGFE

"Empower your women, you empower a nation."

-- @UN_Women chief @phumzileunwomen explains why she supports women & girls in speaking out about injustices, working towards a brighter, more equal, future for all on Awake At Night. https://t.co/AJADqNY8IZ #GenerationEquality https://t.co/JNfGQ9niCR

Legal barriers for women to register births in some countries put millions of children at risk of becoming stateless - which limits their access to education, healthcare & other essential services, @unicef & @refugees warn. 👇
https://t.co/uqlnm4AFfF

"I condemn in the strongest terms the assassination of President Jovenel Moïse of the Republic of Haiti."

-- @antonioguterres says the UN will continue to stand with the Government and the people of Haiti.
https://t.co/PzuHRiH9xH

"Every effort must be made to reverse the spiraling protection crisis for children."

-- @UNICEFchief on attacks on children across Burkina Faso, Cameroon, the Central African Republic, DR Congo, Niger & Nigeria.
https://t.co/dWovvEbkXc

Bodily autonomy - the power & agency to make choices about your own body & future - is a human right.

#StandUp4HumanRights and join @UNFPA and others around the world in saying: #MyBodyIsMyOwn. https://t.co/rsARvWC3Dz

From reducing indoor heat to mitigating cyclone impacts, a new @UNEP guide shows how buildings & community spaces can be constructed to increase resilience to the climate crisis. https://t.co/4tU5elfiay

The situation in Myanmar has evolved from a political crisis in early February to a multi-dimensional human rights catastrophe, @UNHumanrights chief @MBachelet tells Human Rights Council. https://t.co/KYMxNqscH3

10 years after South Sudan's independence, 2 out of 3 children in the country need urgent humanitarian aid - more than ever before.

@UNICEF is doing everything possible to reach the most vulnerable, but more funding is needed. https://t.co/Fu83Ew6ABx

Join Peter Rabbit in celebrating our food heroes!

From farmers to grocers, grocery shoppers and cooks, everyone can become a food hero by wasting less food and buying local produce. 

More #ClimateAction tips from #PeterRabbitFoodHero: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/Bctw0Yv2PX

#COVID19 has led to the first rise in extreme poverty in a generation, with half of the world population not covered by any social protection.

More from @UNDESA's latest #SDGreport: https://t.co/iP69guNUbS https://t.co/UI5BV0nVVU

More than 2 million school-aged children are now out of school in Yemen.

@UNICEF calls for urgent action to protect boys & girls amid the prolonged and devastating conflict. https://t.co/eQsG1ZlpB7 https://t.co/Wl7TdmYj6V

Critical times call for bold solutions. To prevent the next pandemic, the world must rally around the #GlobalGoals. 

This week's #HLPF will set course towards a greener, safer, more just future.  https://t.co/NLvHiyNwEM https://t.co/E1yJvaPMg1

"The most impossible job on earth."  
Since 1945, 9 Secretaries-General have taken on the challenge of leading the UN, working towards a better world.

Our latest @tiktok_us explains what it takes to be UN Secretary-General. https://t.co/hCRnlclYfg https://t.co/fjPJWs5dyI

Asia-Pacific is the world's most populous region with great potential to grow sustainably. 

At this week's Regional Climate Week, @UNFCCC brings countries together virtually to build a greener, more resilient future. https://t.co/mksTeC88Sb #ClimateAction https://t.co/ucQ7XMcT3O

We are in this together -- and #OnlyTogether will we end the pandemic. 

See the many ways people around the world are coming together & showing solidarity in our latest @TwitterMoments.
https://t.co/Nfbe7NGkeW

🔥Drought
🌊Floods
🌀Hurricanes
Climate shocks are taking away food from plates, leaving 15 million people hungry. 

With EU support, @WFP is providing food assistance to help vulnerable communities. 

Watch & share. #UniteToBeatHunger https://t.co/M7xUAXjOr5

By 2050, there could be more plastic than fish in the ocean. The time to #BeatPlasticPollution is NOW.

The incredible images from around the world featured in this inspiring exhibit show how #PlasticIsForever: https://t.co/nPGl2lw8yU https://t.co/I12RNWzrDy

The world comes together at UNHQ in NYC this week to discuss ways to recover from the pandemic, and turn crisis into an opportunity for a more sustainable global economy. #HLPF

https://t.co/0wVQcEe6Fk

Noncommunicable diseases, like heart diseases, are responsible for 41+ million deaths annually - that's about 70% of all deaths globally. 

You can reduce your health risk by avoiding tobacco, unhealthy foods & sugary drinks. More health tips from @WHO: https://t.co/TZ34wXTGkU https://t.co/9XgsfojT0F

The climate crisis is a child rights crisis. It impacts the rights of children and young people to healthcare, clean air, education and more.

Learn how to protect their rights with this guide created by young activists and @UNICEF experts: https://t.co/JtQ2QLf1R2 https://t.co/McpJWL83IO

Mauritania provides more than 750 military & police officers to @UNPeacekeeping.

We thank these brave men & women, who leave their families behind to protect others, for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/cRbatBsruh

Misinformation is costing lives & prolonging the #COVID19 pandemic.

Check out our latest @tiktok_us and #PledgeToPause & verify facts before sharing information online. https://t.co/uxo77Pss1s https://t.co/qKGdXBhRM2

📢 Calling all photographers! The annual photo competition for the 2022 @WMO calendar is open for entries.
Submit photos relating to weather, climate, water as well as next year’s #WorldMetDay theme on disaster risk reduction: Early Warning & Early Action. https://t.co/wXQnQ8xcN5 https://t.co/oUz2NrMNg2

Media has a fundamental role to play in stopping rape culture.

All of us can also help by changing the narrative that places blame on victims and by using the power of language in service of survivors, not perpetrators. https://t.co/DZU8j777f3 #ActForEqual via @UN_Women https://t.co/ri9Jdzh1v2

Misinformation is costing lives and prolonging the #COVID19 pandemic.

Take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation — and the virus. https://t.co/uxo77PaR9U #PledgeToPause https://t.co/zLzhJGXbQC

82.4 million people worldwide were forcibly displaced at the end of 2020.
Every single one of them is a human being with a unique story of suffering and loss.

-- UN communications chief @MelissaFleming explains the importance of breathing life into numbing numbers.

"There is no place for children in conflict & we must not allow conflict to trample on the rights of children."

-- @antonioguterres called on Security Council & UN member countries this week to strongly support the protection of children at all times. 
https://t.co/q74pRHX1PI https://t.co/frw1cPzD4n

Everyone who wishes to pursue their education should be able to do so without facing bullying, harassment or discrimination. In a fearless future, education is inclusive for all, #LGBTIQ+ youth included. https://t.co/4mAFGnwLv5 #YouthLead https://t.co/cNUttPXlDk

Interested in ocean affairs and law of the sea? 

The UN - Nippon Foundation Sustainable Ocean Programme Fellowship programme is now accepting applications: https://t.co/aUN4PYD0j8

From buying local produce to recycling & wasting less food, all of us can take #ClimateAction

Our latest @tiktok_us has tips from Peter Rabbit on how to be a food hero like him. https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV #PeterRabbitFoodHero https://t.co/NNTW3g81Tx

From digitalization & inequality to the climate emergency & crisis response, @UNDP's new video series examines the critical issues facing humanity & the planet today, and how this will shape the future of development: https://t.co/WH5xvx3lc9 https://t.co/GcyiGGKH2O

Congratulations to the six inspiring athletes selected to compete at the @Tokyo2020 Paralympics for the #RefugeeParalympicTeam this year!
https://t.co/1dz4FJJLRe

What we eat, and how that food is produced, affects our health and the environment.

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero by eating more sustainably - cook more plant-based meals, buy funny-looking veggies & educate others to do the same. https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/kz3WmQjGzp

"At the UN you have to be really professional. You have to have the will. You have to love your work."

-- @UNPOL Officer Patrice Ouffoue, from Côte d'Ivoire, shares his experience working in child protection with @UN_CAR. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/fnvCvrc35N

Cooperatives employ 280 million people - 10% of the total working population globally. 

These community-based enterprises create opportunities for livelihoods & income generation, and can make significant contributions to the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/f3LrFVblun #CoopsDay https://t.co/A3MaVkouM8

A small share can have big consequences.

Whether you’re forwarding a message, retweeting or watching a video -- take a moment to PAUSE & verify facts before you share. https://t.co/uxo77Pss1s #PledgeToPause https://t.co/0fWKbBJmtS

Saturday's #CoopsDay is an opportunity to celebrate the human-centred business model of cooperatives, which can reduce inequality, create shared prosperity and better respond to the impacts of #COVID19. https://t.co/f3LrFUTKCP https://t.co/s6mmCGwmXW

Tigray: 400k people have crossed threshold into famine, with nearly 2M on brink, say UN officials at Security Council, appealing for immediate humanitarian access to Ethiopian region.
https://t.co/hQg5dnuvkc

Cooperatives around the 🌍 are facing the #COVID19 crisis with solidarity & resilience, offering communities a people-centred & environmentally just recovery.

More on Saturday's #CoopsDay: https://t.co/f3LrFUTKCP https://t.co/yUlOeSJzjG

Good news: Research confirms that our #PledgeToPause campaign has helped reduce the spread of #COVID19 misinformation. 

Join people around the world in taking time to verify facts before you share something online. 
https://t.co/0A8gw7p8Oa https://t.co/czfAYjr3Ha

"We have the solutions to make sure that everyone gets adequate power in a clean way. We just need to implement them now."

-- @DamilolaSDG7 from @SEforALLorg explains how providing sustainable energy for all saves lives & the planet: https://t.co/rXLM50eMAD #ClimateAction https://t.co/f0PZnzu1Z9

Misinformation during #COVID19 puts lives at risk. 

Take time to PAUSE & verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/uxo77PaR9U #PledgeToPause https://t.co/yxckxOOGKE

Plastic pollution impacts the daily lives of people around the world. Have a look at its effects in the powerful #PlasticIsForever exhibit, and get inspired to help #BeatPlasticPollution: https://t.co/nPGl2lw8yU https://t.co/LqhtpitbWc

UN Peacekeepers from Côte d'Ivoire serve at great personal risk & in harsh conditions to help others.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/fVQDwPGqt4

Combatting misinformation is key to defeating the #COVID19 pandemic.

See how leaders and governments around the world joined the UN family to #PledgeToPause and stop the spread of misinformation.
https://t.co/UjnTEHgIHg

3 in 10 people worldwide have not been able to wash their hands with soap & water at home during the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Without urgent action, billions risk still being without lifesaving access to water & sanitation services by 2030. https://t.co/f5TDXw0VZj

New record high temperature for Antarctic of 18.3° Celsius has been recognized by @WMO. The Antarctic Peninsula is among fastest warming regions of the world. 

This new record shows once again the urgent need for #ClimateAction. https://t.co/HmQyxlW7uA
https://t.co/lF4aU4thXS

Social protection measures have been key to mitigating poverty amid #COVID19.

Yet, support is uneven as powerful social assistance programmes have been out of reach for low-income countries. More from @UNDP: https://t.co/Tf2l1e5EsI https://t.co/bXmmIuGRtW

The world of work should be safe for everyone, everywhere.

@ILO strives to help end all forms of violence & harassment in the workplace, including gender-based violence, and to restore dignity & respect for all. https://t.co/JHBKERs1DE https://t.co/k3wxvKScGw

Protecting plant health can help:
🌱End hunger
🌱Reduce poverty
🌱Protect the environment
🌱Boost economic development.

As the Int'l Year of #PlantHealth comes to an end, let's continue to raise awareness about the importance of healthy plants. https://t.co/33mSYgVY39 via @FAO https://t.co/adCNFg0Gjl

Amid #COVID19, misinformation can be deadly.

But all of us can do something about it: #PledgeToPause and take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation -- and the virus. https://t.co/q5ZFkROycf https://t.co/Rkc7ULjGvj

France assumes the rotating presidency of the Security Council for the month of July. 

Follow @franceonu for updates: https://t.co/SGwHOsRBep https://t.co/Huq2lKqxtj

Human rights are for everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love. 

🖤♥️🧡💛💚💙💜

As #PrideMonth comes to end, see how you can continue supporting UN 
@free_equal all year round in the fight against transphobia, homophobia & biphobia: https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag https://t.co/veOg3hRTD5

Number of migrant workers has increased by 5 million since 2017, according to latest @ILO estimates. 

#COVID19 has highlighted critical role migrants play as essential workers & exposed their vulnerabilities in informal or unprotected jobs. https://t.co/YlmNab8PlW #DecentWork

In a fearless future, all young people are celebrated & supported on their journeys — regardless of their gender, sexual orientation or ethnicity. 

UN @free_equal explains how you can help make this future a reality: https://t.co/4mAFGnfaDx #YouthLead https://t.co/nf8IlE70WH

The pandemic’s impact on tourism could result in a $4+ trillion loss to the global economy.

Advancing #COVID19 vaccinations to protect communities & support tourism’s safe restart is key to recovery. More in the latest report from @UNCTAD & @UNWTO: https://t.co/f7r3DxPnbv https://t.co/322radYSRv

We all love to share. But sharing misinformation is harmful & it spreads faster when we're upset. 

On #SocialMediaDay, we ask you to #PledgetoPause & verify information before you share it online. https://t.co/uxo77Pss1s https://t.co/OgBpyicfGw

World leaders & activists will launch concrete, ambitious actions for gender equality at the #GenerationEquality Forum, which kicked off on Wednesday in Paris. 

Be part of it & #ActForEqual: https://t.co/GjLJwP3Wz8 via @UN_Women https://t.co/yK0axGvxrK
